title: Inner Strife
description: A group of men no longer agree with the leadership and are encouraging others to leave with them. Do we let them go, try to convince them to stay, or put an end to this rebellion before it spreads?

options.text: Beck - If they don’t want to be here, we shouldn’t force them. Let them go and hope they find peace out there.
options.outcome: The dissenters leave peacefully, but their departure weakens morale. While they're wished fairwell, some wonder if they've made a dangerous choice.

options.text: Old-Timer - Let’s talk to them. Maybe we can offer better conditions, some reassurances. We need to stay together.
options.outcome: Through careful negotiation, most stay. Some still leave, but the settlement remains largely intact.

options.text: Shady - This isn’t a democracy. We can’t afford division. Lock them up before this spreads.
options.outcome: The dissenters are imprisoned. Order is maintained, but fear lingers. Some question if this was necessary.
